website_summaries.verdict: More sensitivity than the usual optic mouse allows for wider and longer-term use, from casual surfing to hours of computer work to frequent gaming.
pros: Users report an extremely comfortable, pain-relieving ergonomic mouse that’s relatively low in cost for its functionality
The matte finish prevents hands from slipping, and there's a shorter learning curve than other mice of this type
cons: May be too large for smaller hands
the one surface it doesn't seem to work on is glass

customer_reviews.title: ONLY LASTS FOR 3 MONTHS THEN DIES!!!  REVISE 2...it stopped working again DON'T BUY THIS MOUSE
customer_reviews.text: GARBAGE!!!! DON'T GET THIS MOUSE!!!1 It was great when I first got it, but now it's losing its tracking ability.. I keep putting in new batteries but still it doesn't track any more. Does any company make a product that doesn't break after 6 months? REVISE They sent me a replacement! Thanks! REVISE 2 NOW THE SECOND ISNT WORKING. THE LASER MUST DIE AFTER 3 MONTHS. don't purchase this!!!! AGAIN! It stopped working...the mouse is all over the place...this mouse onlyl works for a few months then, I guess the laser dies out
customer_reviews.author: Eric Rosner

customer_reviews.title: Vertical Mouse Comparison: Evoluent, Anker, Delux, and LB1
customer_reviews.text: My ranking for wireless vertical mice: 1. Evoluent. Great functionality with extra programmable buttons, nice feel, good on the ergonomics but second to Delux. Overall my favorite though because of the extra buttons - I'm a power user and love the extra functionality. 2. Delux. Best ergonomics, great buttons, good price. I love that I can rest my palm on it. 3. Anker. The buttons take too much pressure, which puts strain on my hands. Otherwise great, especially for the price. 4. LB1. Overall cheap feeling, bad buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not made for small hands
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is so painful. I just started using it today and couldn't use it for more than 10 minutes. I felt like I was constantly readjusting my grip because I couldn't reach the clicks. The design is so high the your wrist is hovering in the air with no support which makes it painful. This might be good for someone with large hands but if you have small hands this is not the right mouse for you trust me.
customer_reviews.author: Merelyn Reads

customer_reviews.title: Bummer
customer_reviews.text: I very much wanted to like this mouse. It's very comfortable to use, and I have small hands. The problem is with the tracking. The cursor constantly froze, to the point where I wanted to fling the mouse across the room. I called Anker tech support. They told me to switch USB ports for the transponder, which I did. Several times. They told me to reboot my laptop. Which I did. I also tried three mouse pads, each with a different type of surface. Nothing helped. This is the worse mouse I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Neil A. Chesanow

customer_reviews.title: Amaing mouse if you have hand discomfort
customer_reviews.text: Amazing mouse. I have a weak base thumb as a result of three pregnancy swells and typing for work. I had to find something other than going to therapy weekly for the pain relief. I bought this after it made sense to me that the way you hold this mouse is like the relaxed hand position. I paired this with a slanted ergonomic keyboard and the pain is a lot less. I type extensively for work and I love this mouse. In the year that I've owned it, I've had to change the battery once. The cursor movement is real smooth and the side thumb buttons are super helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Bruina07Top Contributor: Korean Beauty Products

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: As I have rheumatoid arthritis and teach online courses for a living, switching from my laptop's touchpad to a mouse brought great relief. And this ergonomic mouse, recommended by a colleague whose background includes physiotherapy, has been such a game-changer!! My right hand rarely cramps or experiences pain beyond the usual whole-body background pain of RA, and I have been working twelve-hour days without issue. This mouse is so comfortable; it's almost as if it were created for my hand!! I've had to replace batteries every three-four weeks, but considering how much use this mouse receives, it's quite understandable. This mouse is truly awesome!!
customer_reviews.author: Susanne Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mouse and even better customer service
customer_reviews.text: Received the mouse and after few days of usage realised the mouse has sharp edges near palm touching corner. I emailed customer service with images and they simply sent a new replacement. The mouse is a delight to use. Requires 2x AAA batteries (not included though :( ) . Coming fromthe mouse was a natural transition. The mouse is plastic but not a slippery one. As far as functionality is concerned, the mouse is a full sized one. My first finger fits perfectly while the second finger sometimes slips slightly below the right click. Overall, it is a must-have replacement for traditional mouse or for people who are not gamers. Size comparison is with Logitech G700s series.
customer_reviews.author: ArchVenus

customer_reviews.title: WEIGHT AND FEEL ARE ISSUES
customer_reviews.text: Ergonomically the shape is ideal for mitigating RSI however, the surface material is not at all 'grippy' and that slipperiness combined with being too lightweight makes precision work nearly impossible. A proper soft, rubbery surface and some additional mass [like a steel ballast in the base] would definitely be an improvement. I own a competing mouse of similar design that cost nearly $100 and while Anker Vertical mouse seems to be on the right track, in the hand it definitely feels like a device in its price range
customer_reviews.author: MadRhino

customer_reviews.title: A Good Choice for School or Work, not Gaming!
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these exact mouse. They are extremely practical and useful when used for work or school type functions. If you plan to use this for gaming, I would not suggest this mouse. It works great and has the right egomaniacs for a longer period of use, but the tech and responses for gaming is not there. During use of work and school the mouse works fine and responds to this type of tasking. To put a label to it, call it the Good Office Mouse.
customer_reviews.author: K n M

customer_reviews.title: Good design POOR performance
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as for our WFH days due to COVID19 & because the design is similar to ergonomic mouse I use at work. Thats the only good thing about it. The left n right click buttons just stops working suddenly. I can scroll fine but can not click. I read online sometimes there is interference issue, so I tried it with our Bluetooth key board off, still same issue. We tried it on three different laptops, two different keyboards n the issue is persistent. While the design is good the performance of this is very very very poor!
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: This thing is saving me!
customer_reviews.text: Who would have seen that an OLD SCHOOL mouse could have caused me so much pain! It literally kicked my but using a traditional mouse. The angle on this thing really alleviates a lot of the carpel tunnel issues I am out of nowhere experiencing. BUT: It's too narrow. A wider grip is needed. More like holding a ball. SO... I improvised with some duct tape (of course) and foam rubber. Wallah! Solution! There are some carpel tunnel mice out there that are $75-$100.. which is ridiculous. These folks have made a decent product that is affordable. The wireless connection is seamless as well. This is a smart purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jim L.

customer_reviews.title: Short lifespan.  Worked fine for two years, but now it randomly stops responding during use
customer_reviews.text: I was perfectly happy with this mouse for the first two years I had it. But in the last couple weeks, it randomly stops responding while I'm using it. I'm not talking about waking it from sleep mode. I mean I am actively using the mouse and it just stutters for a second or two. It happens on a daily basis and is becoming very annoying. It's not my computer because I tested it out with another laptop, and the same issue reoccurs. I've always been a fan of Anker products, but now I'm not sure how I feel about their products' longevity.
customer_reviews.author: haewon225

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I work on a computer 9-12 hours a day... I started feeling wrist pain at the end of each day... I knew it was because of my mouse... I decided to try this mouse and although it took some getting used to, it was the best money spent all year.. Such a great bargain price. Ive been using this mouse all day everyday at work for about 4 months and I havent had any pain at all in my wrist the entire time using it... I will be buying another one soon for my house office because I get soo tired of bringing it home every day after work in case I have to work from home.. BUY IT!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. RarebreedBrooks

customer_reviews.title: Keep having problems with these
customer_reviews.text: I've now purchased this mouse twice and had problems within the first year. The first one was having issues waking from sleep mode so I tossed it out. When my coworker showed me hers working perfectly, I thought I should give it another shot. A little less than a year later and I'm having some connectivity issues to the dongle. The mouse becomes poorly responsive and I have to disconnect/reconnect the dongle for it to work again. I use this mouse during my 9-hour workday and I have to reconnect the dongle twice per day. The mouse feels great in my hand and I like the look but the inconsistencies drive me crazy. I don't recommend this device.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: This mouse has greatly helped my carpal tunnel problems, although I probably would be able to say the same about any decent vertical mouse. The only problem is battery life: I only got two months of life using a pair of brand new Energizer Ultimate Lithium batteries. Other mice that I own last a year or more on inexpensive non-lithium batteries. I've been leaving it turned on since with my other wireless mice that works fine, but I'll try turning it off when not using it (when I remember!) to see if that helps prolong battery life. However, it shouldn't be necessary to do this. I'm disappointed with Anker -- I've really like all their other products that I've purchased.
customer_reviews.author: AScopes

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but short lived
customer_reviews.text: Although the mouse is very comfortable to use and has a satisfying click/scroll I’m only giving one star. The reason being after about 4 months the pointer tracking becomes atrocious. It has terrible lag and doesn’t track properly at all. I tried repairing it, reinstalling drivers, and changing the USB port it uses and nothing’s working. I compared it to another wireless mouse of mine and the other one works fine with the same settings. Therefore I can only assume it’s an issue with the mouse’s laser. After some more digging I saw more similar complaints in the reviews for this mouse. It’s comfortable and smooth but after a few months you might as well throw it out.
customer_reviews.author: Chris F.

customer_reviews.title: Ok while it lasted......DO NOT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: This was a fairly comfortable mouse, did the job, until it up and died! It lasted about 11 months, so I guess I should be grateful, compared to some of the other reviews. I believe a product should last a heck of a lot longer than that! And of course, for warranty information Amazon directs customers to go to the Anker website, but once you go there isn't any option for customer service or warranty on products. There is NOTHING I HATE more than getting the runaround and LACK of customer service!!!!
customer_reviews.author: MSD

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work long
customer_reviews.text: I generally love Anker products, but not this one. I bought one and worked with it about a week and decided we both needed one for school so I bought 2 more. Now we have 3 that only work off and on. We are constantly checking batteries to see if they are making connections and turning them off and on to see if that helps. I love the shape, but I don't need a paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: G Schorsch

customer_reviews.title: Great Precision on a high res monitor
customer_reviews.text: I got this not for the ergonomic aspect but because with my old mouse I had a hard time grabbing the corners of my windows. I think that's largely because of the resolution of my monitor - 3840 x 2160. This one is much better than my old one - it was a Logitech M510. It does feel good in my hand too. The back and forward buttons over the thumb are a little awkward but not too much. And for the price it's great. I've had it about 4 days.
customer_reviews.author: John Seiffer

customer_reviews.title: After 1 year the mouse is starting to die
customer_reviews.text: The mouse isn't working properly anymore, and I treat it good. What's happening is that there is a consistently lag and sleep mode then turns on and off, changing the batteries, surface texture, etc. doesn't do anything. It sucks because this is by far the best mouse out there in turns of lifespan, durability, and comfortability, but the face it has this issue is depressing. I've owned 2 of these mouses in the past 3 years (and another brand in between the two Anker mouses). I've had excellent support from Anker, so I'm reluctant to leave a bad review, but I just want to put this out there
customer_reviews.author: thomas devine

customer_reviews.title: Love the old one, Hate the new one
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these. The first arrived in 2017 and I am still using it. It works very well and has the correct angle for my wrist. My only wish is that its had three buttons. I would give it 5 stars The second I just received three month ago and hate it. I have only used it lightly and it is completely unusable. It works well for 2-3 minutes after I turn it on, then the cursor is very stick and jumpy like the battery is low. If I install new batteries (that I have verified with a voltmeter) the red light flashes like they are almost dead.
customer_reviews.author: Teri Elliott

customer_reviews.title: If you have not gone vertical, it changes everything.  If you have, this one is a great value.
customer_reviews.text: First time vertical so I Love that part. However, it is slippery which is something they should fix because it is bad enough that you need to expend useless energy to keep it in place. The similar unit from logitech is 3-4 times more money, so I am living with the slip for now. Also, after just several days, I am seeing smear marks onj the forefinger button. Not sure why that is. But if it is due to anything on my hand, that is unacceptible with the kind of materials available today to repel fluids from the surface of the plastic device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice! Back to using my right hand again.
customer_reviews.text: So, earlier this year my right wrist started to really be a problem after over 25 years of working with computers daily. I switched to my left hand. That was quite a learning curve! It took a month to be comfortable, and 2 to 3 months to be about 60% as efficient as I am with my right. Then searching Amazon I saw a vertical mouse for sale. After reading the description, I ordered this, one of the lower priced ones, immediately. I have had this thing on the computer for about 10 minutes, back to my right hand, and it felt so natural that I know I had to come leave this review. Definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Painful to use
customer_reviews.text: Not better (actually worse) than regular mice for someone suffering from De Quervain's tenosynovitis. I bought this to alleviate my pain, but it was clearly a mistake. I tried to contact Anker support but they were completely indifferent about the issue and they chalked it up to me not used to it, highly disappointed. And in the end, they offered me a 15% ($2.7) refund which I found insulting so I refused. Oh, and batteries are not included.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Mouse
customer_reviews.text: A coworker told me about this mouse. It was reasonably priced and works great. I love the design because he keeps me from having issues with my wrist. I use rechargeable batteries in the mouse so I am not going through batteries. I've had the mouse for at least two years and it is still working like it did the first day I purchased it. I've purchased one to leave at my office and a second to use at home. I highly recommend this product especially if you are having pain in your wrist from typing and using a mouse. It just takes a little getting use to.
customer_reviews.author: Jman777

customer_reviews.title: You need to grip this mouse and didn't fit my hand well
customer_reviews.text: The mouse would basically slide right out of my hand if I wasn't gripping it with my thumb and pinkie, and the stretch to the scroll wheel was too much. I don't have large hands, but they're not small either. I use my computer for drafting and design, so the scroll button is just as important as the other buttons and it would have caused a strain to keep stretching for it. The material it's made of is very soft, it feels good to the hand, but also feels slippery. All in all, I like the vertical mouse style, but this one wasn't for me.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Tom

customer_reviews.title: Second vertical mouse and this one fitss perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I had a larger vertical mouse prior that I liked but when this was on sale, I couldn't pass up on the price. Glad I bought it. It's very comfortable and extremely easy to use. It responds quickly and scrolls fast. It has a slight rubberized finish that keeps the hand from slipping. I highly recommend this mouse. One note about the company.....I've purchased several different types of Anker products. I've never been disappointed. Great designs in everyone of them and well engineered. Quality seems to be a priority for them.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Fischer

customer_reviews.title: High quality mouse
customer_reviews.text: I used Acedada mouse as well. For similar price, Anker mouse is far better quality. It uses/drags very smooth, reacts promptly. The 4 feet pads are properly attached, not like Acedada brand. Anker mouse is very comfortable to use. The material is also sturdy. My previous one last over a year after my son smashed it on the floor, the middle wheel doesn't work anymore. I am very happy with the quality of Anker mouse. For mouses of similar price, this is a good deal. What they can improve is to make it USB chargeable. But, that is not important comparing to the quality and comfortableness of use.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Too lightweight
customer_reviews.text: The mouse has a great shape which has helped my wrist pain. However, it is extremely difficult to use the mouse due to it's being so lightweight that any clicks move the mouse such that my hand is nowaching from trying to hold the mouse still while clicking. Use with a hard mousepad is not advised, I'm hoping a cloth pad will add enough friction to help.
customer_reviews.author: S. Solomon

customer_reviews.title: Have three now.
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these at my office office, before the pandemic. I started using my "home" traditional horizontal mouse and after having surgery to remove two Volar Ganglion cysts, I can't comfortably operate without a vertical mouse. This one is perfect in all regards. Shaped well, accurate pointing, long lasting battery. This is my third one.
customer_reviews.author: Dobbin

customer_reviews.title: Feels Great, However Performance...
customer_reviews.text: i bought this mouse along with the Logitech MX vertical mouse. i have medium sized hands and this mouse was just a little bit too small. however the shape of it i absolutely love! great shape. however, here comes the bad news. it’s not sensitive. if you use a very high DPI like myself you’ll find yourself moving the mouse very little by little... and when you do that with this mouse it doesn’t respond. little movements sometimes did not register. the MX Vertical from Logitech is better when it comes to that. so, 1.shape is great 2. size isn’t fit FOR ME 3. only feels cheap because it doesn’t register small movements.
customer_reviews.author: FruityReverb

customer_reviews.title: This mouse has made all the difference
customer_reviews.text: I am writing a dissertation and I spend ridiculous amounts of time at the computer writing and reading. I use the mouse instead of the trackpad on the laptop. I just recently purchased a slim computer, very powerful and super portable. Well, this mouse has helped me to keep my wrist and arm from hurting. What an amazing difference it is to have my wrist in a slightly different position. I couldn't be happier with this mouse. Also I like the feel of it in my hand. The only thing is I had to get used to scrolling with the middle finger instead of the index finger, but that has not been a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Jon D. Jaramillo

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse for the price, bad wireless connection
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, tracks well and very comfortable to use. Great ergonomics, helped a lot with RSI in my wrist. Not a very serious gamer, but it works well enough for me to stay competitive in online games with friends. Wireless connection doesnt have a very long range is my only issue. My computer is about 3 feet from that part of the desk and wireless was very spotty. It would drop off a lot and cause issues. Had to use a USB extender to get the dongle closer to my keyboard, which seems like a waste so I returned and got a better wireless angled mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid and very affordable
customer_reviews.text: Worked just fine, except when I had the USB dongle plugged in away from the device in a way that the computer itself may have caused interference. Moving the dongle to the same side as the mouse itself seemed to clear up jerky response. Otherwise, feels good in the hand and does all I want as a Mac user. No idea how it would be for gaming, because there's not much of that on the Mac, and the page-forward and -backward buttons on the thumb side are Windows only (they'd be nice to have, or at least nice to be able to reprogram, but this is a very small deal).
customer_reviews.author: David Bloom

customer_reviews.title: Nice for arthritic elbows and wrists but cheap parts
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this mouse and for the most part, I do. However, I'm a little annoyed with how cheap some of the parts are. I dropped this mouse from maybe like 3 feet or so onto hardwood (which I know is my fault) but the plastic flap that holds the batteries just popped out and the hinge that keeps it in place snapped off. Now I have to use tape to keep it shut. It's still functional and I do really like how it feels but that's kinda lame. So, lesson learned...dont drop your mouse. duh. right?
customer_reviews.author: laal

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd vertical ergonomic mouse. It took about 2-3 weeks to get used to the feel of it and how to keep it in my grip. Once I got used to it, it was great. Unfortunately, after about 1 year of use, it started flaking out. The mouse cursor started staggering for a few seconds at a time several times per minute. At first, I thought it was some sort of interference, but even when I used the mouse just a few (10 or less) inches from the dongle, it still staggered with no improvement. Searching Anker's user forums shows many users with similar complaints.
customer_reviews.author: B. Smart

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Bettery Life
customer_reviews.text: Horrible battery life! Love the mouse itself, love the feel. However I started using this mouse on 7/30 (JUST at my job) and today, 9/11, I'm putting in my 3rd set of AAA batteries. And there is no warning....it will be working and then all of a sudden - nothing. Gotta have extra batteries on hand or a back up mouse. Very disappointing because good batteries aren't cheap and I'm on battery #6 in 6 weeks (takes two AAA). That is really my only complaint about this mouse. For my carpal tunnel and tennis elbow, I totally feel the difference. Changing the wrist position is helpful. Just really wish the battery life was better.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Worst Mouse I Have Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: This mouse does not reliably track. The mouse behaves as if it is being used on a porous surface like a shag carpet. The cursor stops and goes even when doing mundane tasks like web browsing. Don't even get me started on how frustrating it is for gaming! I'm using a Steelseries QCK mousepad. I have tried different batteries and I have tried plugging the fob into different USB ports. This is quite simply a trash mouse. Unfortunately, I am past the point of being able to return it so I'm out $20 for something I'm going to literally throw in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: CC38

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with it
customer_reviews.text: My current computer set-up isn't the most ergonomic, but this mouse helps quite a lot. It feels good in my hands and only took a day to get used to. I had to adjust the DPI to the lowest setting to keep the cursor from flying across the screen with the slightest mouse movement and occasionally I have to do that again, but other than that, I am happy with it overall. (I find I rarely use the page back/forward buttons.) Also, I noticed today that this is designed for the Linux platform, but I use it with a Dell PC with no problems. I have a dual-boot system I'll have to try it on.
customer_reviews.author: LCW

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse while it lasts
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I don't think there's a better ergonomic mouse out there. It's very responsive, comfortable and in general just works well... while it lasts. I've already had 3 of these mice, and lifespan is about 1 year. After that, issues start to appear, like the pointer jumping all over the screen, or the scroll buttons starting to act up. I use these devices all day at the office, so they have been heavily used during the year. And honestly, for less than $20 a year, I get a great, comfortable mouse. I like the wireless version, don't know if the wired version would last longer. But again, for the price, they're totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrés

customer_reviews.title: 3.5 years of Gaming and video editing before failure
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this mouse for 3.5 years at my work station and on the go loose in my backpack. Most days are between 7-10 hours. It has held up better than expected for the price and with a rechargeable AAA set is a great purchase. 3.5 years in the scroll wheel has started to go and now scrolls randomly and will scroll the wrong way sometimes. Buttons are still clicky and Only improvement I could ask for is a heavier weight. I am ordering a different ergo mouse to try something new, but would definitely recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Jeffery

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic, but Drifting and Short Range
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is very ergonomic and comfortable. 5 Stars for that. I knock it over quite a bit since it's so tall, but that's my problem! Unfortunately, after only 18 months of using it, I've started experiencing drifting. I've cleaned it, replaced the batteries, etc but it still is an issue. I think if it would have lasted 2 years, I would have been happy, but 18 months is a bit lite. It also has a VERY short range from the dongle. I had to put the dongle in the port on my keyboard, right next to the mouse. It's unfortunate it's not Bluetooth...
customer_reviews.author: mtnlion48

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing in design and construction
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with this product. Firstly it did not help my wrist pain the way I'd hoped: the mouse is not as 'upright' or vertical as I'd expected, and there was still some twisting of my forearm to use it. Secondly, it goes into sleep mode very quickly, and it's extremely annoying to have to click to wake it up all the time. The build quality was incredibly poor: flimsy and cheap: it's made in China and feels like it. I'd rather pay more and get something that's properly made, so I've returned this item.
customer_reviews.author: lady.mantis

customer_reviews.title: Game. Changer.
customer_reviews.text: I go through computer mice very quickly because, not only is my job web design, but I also have Tourettes Syndrome. So I’m always buy new mice and trying different ones. This one, by far, is the best and I will continue to buy this if I ever need a replacement. The ergonomics of it is great for anyone, but especially for those with wrist problems or tics. It’s sturdy, and actually makes using a mouse feel more ‘natural.’ I was skeptical at first bc of the different design, but it is amazing. Would buy again, and will recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Koller

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have this vertical mouse in both wired and wireless. The wireless gets a 4 star because it is a little bit slower and it does not move as smooth as the wired version. (Wired version gets 5 stars for me) The design is perfect for my small hands, and I do use the mouse nonstop for 7 hrs a day. I use the wireless when I want to take a break away from my desk and take my work elsewhere. The wired one stays at my desk. I’ve had both for a year and a half and they both work the same way it did a year ago.
customer_reviews.author: mae

customer_reviews.title: Hard to lift off desk, laggy input.
customer_reviews.text: While it was comfortable to hold and rest my hand on, I could not use it. The ergonomic benefit of it is countered by the need tonpick it up to reposition it as you tend todo with a mouse. The smooth grip surface feels nice, but is slippery and there is not a great hold to lift it due to the way your hand sits. My wrist was more fatigued trying to use this than a normal mouse. The wireless connection was also noticeably jittery/laggy as well. I plugged/unplugged the reciever, which improved it, but it was still noticeable
customer_reviews.author: T. Raabe

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: For the price it was worth a shot to see if it fit comfortably. I spent a few days using it with a laptop for various office apps and some light CAD work, not terribly impressed. There is no support for your pinky so it can drag on the surface if your hands are wide. The scroll wheel click action is a toggle, not press and release. That causes lots of problems when trying to use wheel click to scroll around in CAD. I had problems with the pointer speed changing arbitrarily as well, possibly in connection with wheel click scrolling. Uses disposable batteries, which can be a blessing or a curse depending on your usage habits.
customer_reviews.author: Cranky Old Man

customer_reviews.title: Just buy this already.  Feels great, more comfortable than the Logitech
customer_reviews.text: Just buy this already. It really feels great, and while not as featured as the expensive Logitech, I find it much more more comfortable. (I own both.) I haven't used it for gaming, and if I have a lot of detailed PPT to edit I sometimes go back to a horizontal mouse, but that's just me not unlearning ah... a very long time of "regular" mouse use. I also play drums and I can tell a difference in how I feel if I've been using this verses a regular mouse. Yeah I still knock it over sometimes because I don't lift my hand high enough reaching between mouse and keyboard, but it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: M. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: May actually hurt your hand more than a normal mouse
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of arthritis in my hand. I thought it would be easier to use. It is actually much harder for me to use. Instead of a finger pressing downward against a solid surface, this mouse relies on a pinching motion between thumb and finger, which actually turned out to be MUCH more painful, for me. If your issue is carpal tunnel syndrome, or tennis elbow, or something like that you MAY find this mouse reduces your pain. If your issue is arthritis in your hands, my experience suggests it will not.
customer_reviews.author: David Kn.

customer_reviews.title: Happy so far
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased a few products from Anker and have been satisfied with it. I've experienced wrist strain with my right wrist and so was looking at ergonomic options. I think the wrist rests is probably doing a better job at solving for it than this, but as just a regular mouse it works well. I was concerned about phantom clicks, but that quickly went away after an hour of use to get used to the function of it, and now I don't even think about it being ergonomically different.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Track Wheel Too Far Forward
customer_reviews.text: I like the mouse and it works great ergonomically except for one thing. The track wheel is too far forward. On a regular mouse you can slide your hand up or your hand sites right on top so using the wheel is easy. Because the vertical mouse is between your thumb and forefinger, you have to stretch to use the wheel. This may not be an issue with people with long fingers but anyone with shorter fingers is going to have issues. I have regular size fingers and it is putting a strain on the area between my thumb and forefinger. My suggestion? Look into moving the track wheel further back so it is easier to access.
customer_reviews.author: Gus Yslas

customer_reviews.title: LOVE the wired version, this LAGS terribly. Not an interference issue.
customer_reviews.text: The wired version is one of the best deals ever in a computer mouse. Wonderful, for $15. Cured my finger pain after 25 years+ of mousing. This wireless one - identical to the wired otherwise - has a serious issue with connectivity. AWFUL lagging. I should have searched the reviews for this issue before I bought it but loved the wired so much I didn't think of questioning the company's products. Too bad, the wire is the only irritation of the original version, wireless would have been great.
customer_reviews.author: D. Graves

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse and awesome customer service
customer_reviews.text: When I bought it, I had issues where it indicated the batter was out, despite using fresh batteries, so I contacted support and they quickly and painlessly sent another mouse after proof of purchase. The new one works great and is much easier on my wrists than a traditional mouse. The secondary buttons are kind of awkward for gaming, but not much of an issue for normal use.
customer_reviews.author: Ur210

customer_reviews.title: A good bang-for-buck ratio
customer_reviews.text: When I received this mouse, I was a bit skeptical because of my previous experience with another similar mouse, also an ergonomic one. After a few weeks of use, here's my experience with this particular item: 1- The mouse s reasonably comfortable to use. The buttons are located within comfortable reach. 2. The battery seems to last longer with this mouse. That means it could have a built-in battery management that senses idle/non-use time. 3- Accuracy level is good. Overall, I am happy with this mouse and the price is very good also. I would recommend this model.
customer_reviews.author: Prime User

customer_reviews.title: Awkward feel, stiff clicks
customer_reviews.text: I bought two ergo mice at the same time. This and another brand. This just felt awkward in my hand. The point at the top was ... odd. It doesn't make it uncomfortable, but definitely not more comfortable than a standard mouse. It was difficult to click, especially when I need to do so repeatedly, all day. That may loosen up with use, but I can't wait for that. Several work associates tried it as well and all but one had the same reaction. The elevation is too sharp, at the 80° mark I believe. This might work for you, but... not for me. Going with the other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Not precise
customer_reviews.text: For most users its probably fine, but if you've been using mostly Logitechs, this pales in comparison when it comes to being precise and small, pixel-based movements. Tested with different surfaces, fabric mouse pads, paper, cardboard, no good improvement. Overall mouse feels comfortable for casual uses, but the sensor is probably not very good such that the artifacts can get annoying.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Too large fro small hands
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I'm going to have to pay $5.99 to return an item that I can't even use. I wanted to love it, based on the reviews, but it is simply too large for my hands. My shoulder and even back muscles are hurting from trying it out. I draft in 3D all day long, and purchased the wireless after reading reviews. My desk is also at a slight angle for ergonomics, and it keeps trying to slide off. Without a wire to keep it from falling, I'm afraid it would crash to the floor over time. Hope this review is helpful! I did read great things about the company, but I just couldn't make it work.
customer_reviews.author: a d

customer_reviews.title: Best Mouse, Best Brand, Best Warranty!
customer_reviews.text: this mouse has saved my wrist! I have tendonitis in my right wrist and using a mouse for long periods of time (required for my job) would aggravate it and require a lot of icing. This mouse solved that! It took a little bit getting used to, but now I find normal mice to feel weird. Highly recommend! Recently I ran into with the mouse issue, contact Anker support. Their Warranty IS SUPERIOR. Replaced my mouse. They are stand behind their product and does not give much hassle!
customer_reviews.author: Mar Twain

customer_reviews.title: Too large for smaller hands
customer_reviews.text: Both my wife and I tried this mouse. We both found it too small for our hands. Compounding the issue, I felt that the button resistance was on the high side (it took too much force to depress the buttons). Given that we could barely reach the buttons, the extra force required to actually click them made things worse. The mouse functioned well otherwise, but the point is for it to be an ergonomic mouse, so unless it's ergonomically near perfect, it sort of defeats its own purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: A comfortable mouse to get you through the day
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable. Quality. Unique. Three words that describe what I like about this mouse. 8 hours of work with no fatigue. This ergonomic design makes it feel natural and comfortable through the work day. Build quality is solid with a rubbery texture to grip any task at hand. Design is definitely different from your standard mouse but stands out on the desk. Only complain I have is the wireless usb receiver sometimes doesn’t pick up on my computer right away. I’m not sure if it’s my work computer or the receiver. Overall, I love this mouse. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Joana Childs

customer_reviews.title: 3 stars for product and 5 stars customer support
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse about 2 years ago. The first one stopped work right before the 1 year warranty. I connected Anker's customer support, they were able to send me a new mouse. The 2nd mouse is starting to have different feel to the mouse wheel. When I scroll down on the mouse wheel, it would scroll down and when I let go of the mouse wheel, it would jump/scroll up by it self. There is probably some normal wear and tear in wheel gear that needs to be clean. This is ergonomic mouse, so I wouldn't recommend for games that would require intensive APM.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: AN ABSOLUTE MUST
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS PRODUCT. I started getting pain in my right wrist (mouse hand) at work. A couple co-workers had one and highly recommended one. I got it and haven't had the wrist pain since. I actually had to use a regular mouse for a few minutes (after a few weeks of using the vertical mouse) and I was shocked at how unnatural it felt...I honestly checked to see if I was using a left-handed mouse it felt so weird and uncomfortable. I was afraid it would take a while to get used to, but it didn't I adjusted almost immediately, like within an hour. Recommend to anyone who uses a mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Stops working every 2-to-3 minutes
customer_reviews.text: I tried this mouse out for a few hours after I received it. Using new batteries, it would just lose connection with the USB receiver every few minutes. It would reconnect after a few seconds but that is just not an issue that I can workaround. The distance from the USB receiver plugged into the front of my computer, and the mouse is between 30 to 42 inches. I had to return it since it doesn't work for me. Also, I wanted to get this type of mouse since I started to get 'mouse finger.' Unfortunately, I started to get wrist pain from this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: William R.

customer_reviews.title: Convenient & easy on the wrist
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is by far a godsend during the lockdown. I spend a ton of time on the computer and i had another mouse, a regular one. I had to take constant breaks as my wrist started to hurt. I pretty much knew that this is because of the mouse that i used. I searched amazon & zeroed in on this one as i have bought quite a few Anker products & they were really good I had an issue with this recently and Anker promptly sent a replacement unit immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Ramesh Swamy

customer_reviews.title: It fixed my "computer elbow"
customer_reviews.text: I was having problems with my elbow and my research showed that this type of mouse might help. It was very easy to adapt to, functions well, and does not use up batteries like some of the wireless products I used in past. And what a great warranty! It failed, I contacted Anker about it, filled in a simple form, answered 1 additional question, and BAMM! a new unit was in my mailbox. Now THAT is customer service! Oh, my elbow? It is no longer a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Denworth

customer_reviews.title: you better commit
customer_reviews.text: i do like the idea of this mouse. the problem i have is committing to learning how to use it. i'm a heavy photoshop user, have been for over 20 years. i am still MUCH better at finite movements using a traditionally held mouse. this one would be easier on my wrist if i got good at it. I'm not using it right now, i found out that my wrist problem was that the mouse was too low on the desk. i've raised my mouse platform and now my wrist is feeling better.
customer_reviews.author: egeorge96

customer_reviews.title: The mouse you're looking for
customer_reviews.text: It's not an overstatement to say this changed my life. the vertical stance is so much more natural, and the mouse is so light, you feel almost like a wizard waving around, making things happen on screen. I have carpal tunnel syndrome, and this makes it possible to work a full day and still feel my fingers. That didn't happen with a traditional mouse. It's also very user friendly. I never thought I would use the back and forward buttons, but now they are like second nature. And while the mouse is light, it's amazingly sturdy--my cat likes to play "launch the desk item" and this has held up far better than most other things..
customer_reviews.author: Galvatron

customer_reviews.title: Makes my wrists hurt more, just not a good fit for me.
customer_reviews.text: I have regular sized, regular shaped hands. I work on the computer all day and also spend a lot of time on the computer on my own time. I've had both mild carpal tunnel as well as De Quervain's tenosynovitis (inflammation of tendons on the thumb side) and have gotten physical therapy and worn braces etc. Anyway, to keep this short, this mouse actually aggravates my wrist more than a regular mouse. The mouse itself is well built, just doesn't work for me personally.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew S.

customer_reviews.title: Just didn't fit my hand correctly
customer_reviews.text: I never realized there could be so many differences between vertical mice. This one just never fit in my hand correctly. I finally figured out it's because it's smaller and has a different shape than my other one. My hand kept wanting to slip off of it, and I would get tired trying to keep my hand on it. Additionally, I found the buttons difficult to click because I was trying to hang on the the device. So, honestly, mostly the issue here is me, but I wanted to leave a review so that others with bigger hands would see my review on this one, and choose a different one.
customer_reviews.author: K Brown

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable mouse. Helps hand numbness
customer_reviews.text: I’m an Interior Designer and use computer programs most of the day. I was having issues with numbness in my hand and stumbled upon this type of mouse. I have had the mouse for 4 months and I can’t even remember the last time I had the numbness in my hand. I do feel it could be a bit more upright, but for this price range it’s fantastic quality and very ergonomic. I’m not sure if the buttons are programmable. I hope they are because that would be even better! I need to look I to that.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Scroll wheel glitch - like many others
customer_reviews.text: Update May 2017: Anker customer service was awesome and provided me a replacement. Four stars for now - if the scroll wheel remains problem-free for a year, then I'll consider bumping it to five. Old: Like others have said, the scroll wheel has become glitchy. One swipe on the wheel is enough to result in the web page (or app you're using) to erratically spazz up and down. This is probably the most-used part of the mouse for me, so it's incredibly frustrating to deal with this.
customer_reviews.author: T.Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse for Wrist/Thumb Pain
customer_reviews.text: This mouse has been a lifesaver at home when using personal laptop. Before I bought this mouse my hand would go numb and I would have shooting pain in my wrist and thumb. After just the first day of using this mouse at home, all of that went away - it was amazing! But when I tried to use this mouse with my computer at work, my work computer did not always recognize it. I don't know if that is an issue with my work computer or an issue with the mouse, but it is disappointing because work is where I use my computer the most.
customer_reviews.author: C. Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Amazing mouse!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This mouse feels great in my hand, I love the way it glides so smoothly on the mouse pad, but I had to ding it due to the scroll wheel working intermittently and feeling a bit tight and sticky. It's presented a big problem when scrolling websites and viewing documents and defeats the purpose of it being there. Other than the wheel issue this would be a definite 5 star. Revision: Anker stands behind it's product 100%. Anker has replaced the defective mouse and the new one is flawless. It glides smoothly and all the buttons and scroll wheel work flawlessly. Thanks Anker, you have a loyal customer for life!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Comfy on the wrist and smooth movement
customer_reviews.text: I transitioned from a standard shaped wireless mouse to this. Why didn't I do this sooner! I can feel the relief using this mouse immediately compared to my previous mouses. Not having the turn my hand flat to use the mouse makes a difference especially using it for many years. Although this is for gaming, I can't say it's either good or bad because I don't use it for that purpose, yet there are many buttons that I actually don't need. I was initially concerned I would accidentally click something using it but the buttons are sensitive enough to know whether I push it or not and so far I've had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Clem W.

customer_reviews.title: Best Mouse I Have Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this mouse for over a year. Spending most of my days on my computer, working from home or just enjoying a game. I always had a problem with regular mice aggravating and old wrist injury, this solved it. I bought so many wrist pads, etc to try and solve my wrist pain, but it was the mouse itself. I freaking love this mouse and have a high favorability toward Vertical Mice now. Won't lie, it took some getting used to, but now it's nothing. I have had such a great experience with this mouse it has got me thinking about other Anker products.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel H.

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse ever.
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse. It is a game changer. I first saw it at my physical therapists office. I asked and they recommended it. It's weird at first after having used a regular mouse for soooooo many years, but after a couple of hours you get used to it, and after a few weeks I can't live without it. Sooooo comfortable to mouse in a natural hand/wrist position. Couple with a gel mouse pad for the wrist, and all the pain is gone. I can mouse and game for hours. It's worth the money. Do yourself a favor, end the pain, get this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: This is for a large hand
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed when trying to use this. It is too large. I have a 7" long, medium hand and still was 1/4 to 1/2 inch short of reaching the comfortable position to push the buttons. Otherwise I think it worked okay, but since I didn't use it long, I can't speak to that.
customer_reviews.author: K. Putnam

customer_reviews.title: Don’t lose your job, try this first!
customer_reviews.text: This mouse has saved my arm and my job! I was having severe problems with my left arm, shoulder, and neck. I went to an orthopedic, chiropractor, and a neurologist. I had xrays, MRI’s, physical therapy, and used a TENS constantly. No one and nothing was helping. I finally lost my job that consisted of a lot of typing because I took off so many days at work. I started researching and believe I have Mouse Arm Syndrome (MAS). Yes, it’s a real condition. Thanks to this mouse I’m back to work and I’m not in nearly as much pain. If you’re in pain, try this mouse!
customer_reviews.author: mpark

customer_reviews.title: Good product, Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Good product, Great Customer service. I bought this for my husband and he really likes it. It alleviated his wrist pain. It lasted about a year and quit. I was about to order him another one but emailed Anker first and the customer service was awesome. They responded quickly and after a couple of trouble shooting measures they sent us a new one. Then they followed up to make sure it was working good. I will definitely purchase from them again. My husband says he can really tell a difference from when he uses it and doesn’t with his wrist.
customer_reviews.author: ashnicole

customer_reviews.title: Short Lifespan but otherwise a great mouse
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse on 2018 and it worked wonders until earlier this month, when it started stuttering. Earlier today, after struggling for hours, the batteries inside of it blew up. I never had any other complain about it. I even tried purchasing another model after the stuttering started and was nowhere as pleased with the competition as I am with it (the other one I tried was too heavy), but I am a little worried about that whole, yknow, battery exploding inside of it.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan Wells

customer_reviews.title: Does not track well. Intermittently stops working
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a well tested product. It works intermittently. If you switch the dpi or reboot your computer it may start working again for a while but then it will stop working. Simply does not work at the high dpi setting. The shape of the mouse is nice and it seems reasonably ergonomic. If only it would actually work. It's OK for a laptop but no good for a desktop. If the receiver is as far away as a desktop computer would be, this does not work. Updated 2 a month or so in. Basically has stopped working properly. Unreliable. Not recommended. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Ashwin Kapur

customer_reviews.title: Functional, does not feel practical for all uses.
customer_reviews.text: This product is functional, and really cannot be described by any person on how it fits in their hand. Each person would need to determine for themselves how it fits in their hand. It would not be good for gaming, in my opinion, as it tends to be harder to be super accurate with the mouse pointer. If anything requires you to be super accurate with the mouse, this might not be the route. I think this mouse is strictly for ergonomics, which it does fantastically. It is well built.
customer_reviews.author: Alec Chappell

customer_reviews.title: Short Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these and it was great, very comfortable and easy to use once I got used to it. But then I bought a second for my desktop and now I just can't recommend it. It eats up batteries like crazy, after about a week it starts to become less responsive unless it has brand new batteries. I don't know what they changed about the design in the few months between my purchases but it really ruined an otherwise good product. If they fix the battery usage then it would be perfect but replacing the batteries this often feels like a complete waste.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Not for small hands! LOL.
customer_reviews.text: Ergonomically the mouse felt great, however it was way too big for my small hands. I'm female, with wide palms, but shorter fingers and found it difficult to reach the scroll button. Also, I found the side of my hand unable to rest properly while using the mouse... most likely because my hands were too small. I would recommend this mouse to someone with longer fingers or larger hands. For size comparison, my palm is 4" long from crease to base of middle finger, and my middle finger is 3". Total length 7".
customer_reviews.author: Dickersonak

customer_reviews.title: Great for big hand
customer_reviews.text: My husband has used this mouse for more than year and he loves it. So I bought one for me but for small hands it is little hard to use. I do not feel comfortable to click it so I gave to my husband. I hope Anker has different sizes so I can choose one of them
customer_reviews.author: RFJ

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well - poor design and bad manufacturing
customer_reviews.text: It does not even sit straight on the surface: it tilts forward. Totally unstable. The buttons require more force to press then I like, and holding them for a few minutes strains my wrist. The angle of the button surface is not correct for a neutral position, it is much closer to a classic flat mouse then it should be for an ergonomic one. It skips movement on some surfaces. Overall this was a downgrade from a regular cheap flat mouse, and by far the worst one of the ergonomic models I have tried. Returning and not looking back.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gerasimov

customer_reviews.title: Great design!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this new wireless mouse because my old one was requiring more frequent battery changes. I discovered this Anker Wireless mouse on YouTube and it got such great reviews and kudos from reviewers that I had to try it for myself. And I was NOT disappointed. I love the way it feels in my hand & the ease of using the buttons and the roller-ball. And I love that it goes into sleep mode automatically and therefore really saves on battery life. It's a fabulous device and I am so happy I found it. And you cannot beat the price. In short, I very highly recommend this mouse. You won't be sorry with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JD -  Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but does not work
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is comfortable, and I will use vertical mouses for the foreseeable future, but this mouse constantly gets stuck in one spot and won't move. Something is up with the laser or something, I honestly don't care specifically what is wrong, it just doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mouse for a tired hand
customer_reviews.text: Due to teaching on-line I've been using my mouse hand/arm so much more than usual. It was begining to really bother me and I found that toward the end of the day I did not want to even touch the mouse. With this Anker mouse the pain is gone and I can mouse the day away without issue. It is also very nicely set up in that it sleeps when not in use so that I'm changing batteries much less often than my old mouse. This is by far the best mouse I've ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Bill VanderClock

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but frustrating
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it fairly heavily for a few weeks now and feel comfortable in reviewing it. So far it has been the most comfortable mouse I have used. However, I find it constantly stutters and often gets stuck on the screen. This continued even after trying multiple styles and colors of mouse pads. Another issue I have experienced is I need to manually turn it off when not using it as the batteries continued to drain resulting in need to swap batteries after the first 3 days. I would likely get another vertical mouse in the future but try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My original one broke, contacted seller, they replaced immediately.
customer_reviews.text: I'd had my previous one for about two months tops (I originally thought it was four, but alas...) and it started making an odd sound, then stopped working. Only made the sound when I was clicking the mouse, kinda like it was grinding? I'm not sure. I left a poor review, but was convinced to contact the seller to get a replacement/refund, and they REALLY care about their products and customers. They sent a new one out and it got to me within a couple days. Very grateful, even if their mouse broke, they really owned up to the malfunction of their hardware. Lets see how long this lasts. Not every product is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Maddeh

customer_reviews.title: Great feel.  Great response.  Great value. Great Company and Great Support
customer_reviews.text: here's an updated review... I returned my first unit and the company reached out to me and asked How they could make it right... They followed up and asked what i wanted. They sent a new device really quickly. I'm so very impressed with their service and follow up.. very few companies really care anymore. the new device is wonderful... I'd not paid close attention before to how soft it feels and how very comfortable it is in my hand. It's very light weight, as well and this one responds beautifully. I've used it all day today and my hand feels good... not cramped like with my standard mouse. Great feel. Great response. Great value. Great Company and Great Support
customer_reviews.author: Karen Stavert

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT Ergonomics -- A Little to Sensitive
customer_reviews.text: The mouse did exactly what I had hoped it would do -- it eliminated the pain in my elbow and my shoulder! However, it added a consternation that is keeping it from getting 5-stars. The mouse is so sensitive that, very often when trying to double click, it will shift in position and that will invalidate the double click. I find myself sometimes reaching across with my other hand to hold it still while double clicking. Still a small price to pay for the pain elimination though!
customer_reviews.author: THE Burg

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this get a better brand anker has gone down hill in 5 years
customer_reviews.text: Quality has gone down. I have one from way back in 2016 and then now a 2019. The 2019 version has a gold connector usb and is very loosely pieced together even fits in the usb computer slots loose. Junk!!! My older one works flawlessly still and shows less age than this 2019 version which also has the black surface peeling from use. DO NOT BUY. Amazon needs to fix how many junky sellers they have on eBay slinging sub par quality products that won’t even last a year. I’m sick of this crap.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell McEwan

customer_reviews.title: Too light
customer_reviews.text: Switched from a solid, heavy logitech mouse to this one for its ergonomic features. It is better for the hand and wrist, BUT the device is so light and insubstantial that I find it less accurate and spend more time moving it around than I should. It's also slower and less responsive than I am used to. The design itself is helpful. I got it because my wrist and pointer finger are hurting with a regular mouse. By switching the primary buttons to use the middle finger on the main button, it has helped with the pain. But I may look for a more solid one of the same style.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Excellent results for pain...a few small gripes.
customer_reviews.text: The vertical mouse relieves pain I get in my wrist from an old sports injury, compared to a standard mouse. Some folks report the mouse goes to sleep while they are using it....just click on the left mouse button and the cursor reappears. I've been using this for a week and overall am pleased. Some minor complaints: the surface of the mouse is a little slippery and could be improved with a slightly rougher surface. The page forward and page backward buttons are in an awkward position to reach for my thumb. They are functional, but not without having to change grip on the mouse to access them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: a GREAT customer service story!!
customer_reviews.text: In my initial review, I gave the Anker mouse 3 stars - very much liked the wrist ergonomics, but sometimes had problems with cursor lag or no response to left button click. Maybe an RF issue? Anker proactively contacted me and offered to send a replacement. The new mouse works great. All of the prior problems gone. I'm a vertical mouse convert. Thank you Anker for the fantastic customer service!
customer_reviews.author: berakhah

customer_reviews.title: BROKE AFTER 2 MONTHS - DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse as part of my WFH set-up at the beginning of quarantine in April 2020. Since then, I've replaced the AAA batteries with brand new ones 3 times. Today is June 20th and the mouse won't work/connect even after I tried to replace the batteries a 4th time. (Batteries are from different packs, the most recent one was purchased on a grocery run and is fresh). Mouse is comfortable to use and easy to set up. It was ok while it lasted. But do not waste your money on this low quality electronic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing customer service but not shaped well for my huge hands
customer_reviews.text: Anker always surprises me with their quality customer service. I had an issue with my first vertical mouse and they sent a replacement immediately. The mouse itself is terrific, really, but I have very big hands and lower right pad of my hand ends up on the mouse pad with this vertical mouse. That's not going to work for this kind of device where you really need to be doing full lower arm movement to achieve its promise. It's not a flaw of the mouse itself, just the fact that no device like this will fit everyone, so I'm back to claw-gripping my other mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Welch

customer_reviews.title: I can not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this mouse for a few days now and its terrible. Feels cheap overall. Left and right mouse buttons hit one another. Theres no grip to stop it from sliding. So I'm desperately gripping it tightly. The angle is just a bit off forcing me to forcing my wrist to angle out instead of inward as it natural wants to go. I wish the thumb buttons were arched for easy press instead of being just out of reach. I like ankor products but this is the worst I've purchased by them so far. The return charges 6$. While looking around this mouse looks the same as many others on Amazon and for a cheaper price.
